intro: Lasiorrhiza nutans, commonly known as the nodding hairroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that droop downward. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its unique appearance and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
